TopicTitle: We NEED MatPat to do a KSP Game Theory vefore he retires!

Articles.Content:
I would love to see Mat do a Game theory on KsP. We know, that KSP has some kind of lore, so this should be possible!

There are over 100k people in this forum, so even if 5% of them write a KSP comment, we will be seen.

My suggestion:

When MatPat releases next Game Theory video, we go, and comment something about wanting a ksp game theory. Also we like as many KSP realted posts, as we can, so we can make it to the top! 
 

If you will participate, just like this post, so i know, how many people are with me, and if you have any suggestions, just comment. 

BTW - i would love a KSP game theory, but also kinda scared what Mat is gonna come up with - he’s know for ruining chuldhoods!:)

16 minutes ago, ItanMark said:

There are over 100k people in this forum, so even if 5% of them write a KSP comment, we will be seen.

  • How many of those are active?
  • How many are familiar with this "matpat"
  • How many of those would actually take action? (I'm being nice and I'm not using the phrase "would care enough")

For starters it would help if you explain who matpat is (is he a twitch streamer?  Or perhaps instagram? Tiktok?) And also what the relevance of KSP is to game theory because even if the game would be multi-player (which as this point it isn't) it's hardly a zero-sum game for starters.

  • How many are familiar with this "matpat"
  • How many of those would actually take action? (I'm being nice and I'm not using the phrase "would care enough")

3 hours ago, Martian Emigrant said:

Dito

What is a "Matpat"?

 

ME

MatPat is a pretty popular YouTuber who has about five different channels (Game Theory, Food Theory, Film Theory, etc.), with 18M subscribers on Game Theory alone.

I don't really watch his videos that often, but here's his Wikipedia page.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MatPat

Matpat is a youtuber, along with his team, who makes theorieson videogames and other stuff. F.e. One of his videos was, when he calculated, that the moons in Super Mario Odyssey were the pieces of the actual moon, since it was within Roche limit. So. After 10 years of producing amazing content he is retiring, and announced, that he is goin to do 10 more videos. Sure, his team will continue making videos, but it will never be the same… So i just wanted him to cover KSP.
